title.narrative: Combating Gender-Based Violence and Enhancing Economic Empowerment of Women in Northern Uganda through Cash Transfers

description.narrative: 1.1 Conduct detailed assessment on facilitation of the cash transfer with local finance institution through a tender in national news papers. 1.2 (Re) define village and women targeting criteria and mechanisms. 1.3 Identify 13,710 households for targeted cash transfer according to established criteria. 1.4 Mobilise households for identifying priorities and implementation modalities. 1.5 Establish memorandum of understanding with local finance institution for cash transfer support. 1.6 Develop and facilitate necessary linkages between finance institution and identified households. 1.7 Review monitoring tools and systems. 1.8 Implement programme baseline survey with statistically viable sample size. 1.9 Monitor households’ income, expenditure, food sources and diversity, etc. 1.10 Facilitate programme evaluation and lessons learned. Output 2 : Increased knowledge and awareness about livelihood diversification, investment, marketing, small business management and GBV 2.1 Update the training materials ACF developed during the LEARN 1 and 2, develop additional materials to train participants in general business skills, agronomic practices, livestock management, small business management, value addition, marketing, and other identified skills, etc. 2.2 Develop new materials in relation to GBV for women and men, and introduce GBV component to already exited training materials. 2.2 Conduct trainings according to modules for all participating households. 2.3 Conduct trainings and awareness raising sessions for men and boys. 2.4 Use the monitoring tools and systems developed in LEARN 1 and 2 and develop new ones for activities related to GBV. 2.5 Implement knowledge, attitudes and practices survey in relation to GBV with a statistically viable sample size. 2.6 Monitor knowledge recall, practices and application, and business realisation. Output 3 : Improved capacity of local credit and saving schemes 3.1 Support the set up of village Saving and Loan Associations (VSLAs) for project participants and others. 3.2 Train participants in the efficient use of the VSLAs and provide basic trainings for the leadership and members. 3.3 Follow up and monitor the performances of VSLAs setup through the project and capitalise experience Output 4 : Improved capacity of local women associations and women right groups 4.1 Identify (establish where not yet present) women groups and associations that will support to reduce GBV and can be used as pressure groups in the area. 4.2 Support these groups to use already existing referral systems for victims of GBV. 4. 3 Training for women group leaders and members on women rights. 4.4 Form men and boy groups that support individual women and women groups in the areas of GBV. 4.5 Create linkages of women groups with farmer groups and other male dominated groups to supportive relationships. Output 5 : Documented and disseminated research on process, appropriateness of economic enhancement of women and reduction of GBV through cash transfers in Lango and Acholi sub regions 5.1 Conduct research on the relationship between GBV and economic empowerment of women. 5.2 Study and share experience of cash transfer targeting women in recovery context. 5.3 Incorporate LEARN 1 and 2 results from documentation and capitalisation and build on those experiences. 5.2 Ensure good documentation and capitalisation of steps taken during project definition, preparation, and implementation. 5.3 Ensure effective collaboration with partners in the programme and other stakeholders engaged in documentation and dissemination of lessons learned.

Secondary ParticipantsMembers of the family of participating women are estimated around 22,000 individuals in each year and 66,000 individuals over three years period. The tertiary participants of the project include other members of the VSLA estimated to reach around 30,000 individuals over the three years duration of the project.

To strengthen livelihoods and food security for women in Lango and Acholi sub regions through direct cash transfers and raising awareness in GBV for communities. To strengthen livelihoods and food security, and enhancing economic empowerment of women in Northern Uganda.
